clinical_study.brief_title: Energy Conservation Technique in COPD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Energy Conservation Technique During Stair Climbing in COPD Patients : a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is characterised by non-reversible bronchial obstruction associated with systemic disorders and comorbid factors. Dynamic hyperinflation during an exercise increase dyspnea and can reduce exercise capacity. Stair climbing is associated with prolonged dynamic hyperinflation and severe dyspnea in COPD patients. The aim of this study is to carry out the effect of an energy conservation technique on dyspnea to facilitate stair climbing.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will perform two stair climbing sessions (each session include 108 steps) under two different conditions on the same day with at least 30 minutes of rest between the two sessions. the order of the two conditions will be randomly assigned

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Dyspnea at iso time and at time limit between the two sessions
primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measured before, at the end and every one minute during the stair climbing sessions. The two stair climbing sessions will perform the same day, separate from 30 minutes minimum for a total time frame of 1 day.
primary_outcome.description: Difference in dyspnea using Modified Borg Scale (0 - 10 points) 0=no dyspnea ; 10 = maximal effort

secondary_outcome.measure: difference in time required for the patient to climb the 6 floors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be collected at the end of each sessions. The two stair climbing sessions will perform the same day, separate from 30 minutes minimum for a total time frame of 1 day.
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in time (seconds) will be evaluated using a stopwatch

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Data will be continuously collected during every sessions. The two stair climbing sessions will perform the same day, separate from 30 minutes minimum for a total time frame of 1 day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- a diagnosis of COPD
- Dyspnea in daily living (2-4 on the modified medical research council dyspnea scale)
- clinically stable
Exclusion Criteria:
- exercise contraindication Any musculoskeletal problems, cardiovascular or neurological comorbidities that limits exercise.
- exacerbation during the study
- inability to climb 6 floors
